channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The recipient of nine television Emmy awards dating from his role on Caesar's Your Show of Shows in the 1950s, Reiner was at home as well in movies as an actor, director and screenwriter.
item.title: Carl Reiner, comedy legend who created The Dick Van Dyke Show, dies at 98

item.description: The European Union has excluded the United States from its initial "safe list" of countries from which the bloc will allow non-essential travel.
item.title: EU agrees 'safe' travel list, excluding travellers from the US

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The economy will need more support as a wave of emergency support is withdrawn later this year, but not every business can be saved.
item.title: Avoiding an economic 'cliff' will require more spending

item.description: NSW has elimination – not just containment – of the virus within sight. It can't afford to put that at risk.
item.title: Premier, close the border with Victoria now

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Heritage Victoria and police are investigating whether a bayside home at the centre of a lengthy demolition dispute was deliberately set ablaze - twice.
item.title: Heritage Victoria, police launch investigation into Brighton house fires

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: A culture of silence has failed a generation of women, Fiona McLeod says, after former High Court judge Dyson Heydon was accused of sexually harassing judges' associates.
item.title: 'Cone of silence' hurting women in legal profession: top silk

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: A detailed run down of the Waratahs' schedule for Friday's game against the Reds in Brisbane shows just how different things are going to be this season.
item.title: Revealed: The Waratahs' 16-hour day for Super Rugby AU opener

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Farming and green groups are calling for an environment stimulus package to create tens of thousands of regional jobs and save millions in welfare payments
item.title: Green stimulus could save millions in welfare payments: EY report

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The prominent Australian advertising executive is joining News Corp Australia as the publisher turns its focus to content marketing.
item.title: Former WPP boss Mike Connaghan joins News Corp

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Treasurer Dominic Perrottet ordered a comprehensive review that has called for a radical rethink of state-federal financial rules.
item.title: Abolish stamp duty and lift the GST, says key tax reform review

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Australia now realises it lacks the tools for holding hostile forces of a major adversary at bay.
item.title: China the unspoken threat at centre of new defence strategy

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Mr Velasquez, 42, was found unconscious by police in the stairwell of his Girraween unit complex on December 30 last year.
item.title: Woman arrested in eastern suburbs over death of Vergel Velasquez

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: As restrictions on Sydney’s public transport capacity begin to ease, the NSW government is under pressure to implement the wearing of face masks on the network.
item.title: Calls for face masks grow as restrictions ease on transport system

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, July 1

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: High university fees could reduce women's workforce participation when they have children.
item.title: High HECS debt is another barrier to equal parenting

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The spectacular collapse of one of the former darlings of the technology sector, Wirecard, is more than a rollicking yarn it is a cautionary tale for investors and a serious warning for auditors.
item.title: Wirecard scandal has all the hallmarks of Enron and the carnage that followed

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Councils across the region are seeking to stimulate local economies by fast-tracking infrastructure works.
item.title: South-east Queensland councils prepare to spend but keep rates low

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The Andrews' governments industrial manslaughter laws come into effect on Tuesday, with bosses to face a maximum 25 years in jail over worker deaths.
item.title: Workplace deaths in Victoria almost double under new tally

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Telco created out of the merger between Vodafone Hutchison Australia and telco billionaire David Teoh's TPG Telecom, has been admitted to the ASX.
item.title: New-look TPG Telecom to prioritise mobile performance

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Industrial property giant Goodman Group has expanded its exposure with Amazon after signing a lease at the $1.5 billion Oakdale West industrial park in western Sydney.
item.title: Goodman seals deal with Amazon at Oakdale park

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: With unemployment skyrocketing during COVID-19, more couples are feeling stressed. Here's how you can manage it.
item.title: How to help a loved one if they've lost their job or taken a pay cut

item.description: Australia must make an assessment of our strategic environment unrestricted by budgets to determine the economic, diplomatic and military need.
item.title: 'Give it everything we can': the case for putting winning first and expense second in national security

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Scentre group, the country's largest retail landlord, has seen a resurgence in shoppers and store re-openings across its Westfield malls.
item.title: Westfield welcomes back shoppers to near pre-virus levels

item.description: The Powerhouse building is an important physical remnant of Sydney’s history that deserves to be conserved.
item.title: Doomed Powerhouse site deserves to be preserved

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Greg Combet says there's no shortage of capital for infrastructure, but wants clearer instructions about which projects the super industry should get behind.
item.title: 'Mixed messaging' from state and federal governments over airport rail: Combet

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: The allure of a 10-year triple net lease to infrastructure construction company McConnell Dowell resulted in an industrial warehouse selling for $7.35 million.
item.title: McConnell Dowell warehouse sells for $7.35m

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: Gai Taylor, whose father made the first flight from Sydney to Chile in a Catalina aircraft hanging in the Powerhouse Museum in Ultimo, fears the plane will be wrecked during the institution's relocation.
item.title: 'Slap in the face': Daughter of legendary aviator warns against Powerhouse move

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: “Aged petitioner” asks for divorce, petition dismissed and the romance of Kirribilli Wharf.
item.title: In the Herald: July 1, 1933

item.description: If you’ve woken up one day with the sudden realisation that you’re in the wrong job, you’re not alone.
item.title: When you haven’t yet found your career path

item.dc:creator: Andrew West
item.description: Twenty years ago, the Howard government introduced a goods and services tax, heralding it as a historic transformation of Australia's taxation system.
item.title: From the Archives, 2000: PM Howard braves public's reaction to GST

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The ban on the exporting of waste glass was originally due to come into force on Wednesday.
item.title: Delay to export ban on waste glass fails to reduce squeeze on councils

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Berejiklian government has been accused of using COVID-19 as a cover to speed up approvals for a mine expansion that won't create many jobs until after 2035.
item.title: Coal mine expansion for 2035 gets COVID 'fast-track' approval status

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, July 1

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Three years after buying Elaine in Point Piper, it’s great to see Scott Farquhar putting his stamp on the place. But some boat owners may not be so pleased.
item.title: Atlassian billionaire's reno plans make waves in Point Piper

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says she doesn't support people being friendly before "sending out others to do their dirty work".
item.title: Premier, PM open fire even as Palaszczuk calls for end to border war

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Three of Victoria's former premiers have backed an express rail link to Melbourne Airport, warning that a slow, stopping-all-stations service will not be used.
item.title: Ex-premiers call for fast, direct airport rail route

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Half a century after Melbourne's international airport opened, Victoria is the closest it has been to building a rail link to Tullamarine. Why did it take so long?
item.title: Why it took 50 years for an airport rail link to get off the ground

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin bondholders remain in the dark about how much of the $2 billion they are owed will be repaid under the Bain deal, but fear it will be as low as 6.5¢ in the dollar.
item.title: Virgin investors wiped out in Bain deal as bondholders brace for spare-change return

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Melbourne mother Shari Davison disappeared in February, 1995. Police are now offering a $1m reward for anyone with information that could help solve the cold case.
item.title: 'Help us find peace': $1m reward for information about missing mother

item.description: Until we starting taking the risks seriously, there will continue to be online trainwrecks, with fixes retrofitted after the damage has been done.
item.title: Same mistakes keep exposing children to online dangers

item.description: The last 12 weeks have seen the most significant disruption to our education system in living memory. We can't go back to business as usual.
item.title: Schools interrupted, have learnt valuable lessons

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 1, 2020

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: The first state in the US to shut down and was so proactive in combating the spread of the coronavirus is now being forced to ask itself what went wrong.
item.title: 'Our luck may have run out': California’s virus case count explodes

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Liberals believe they are in striking distance of causing a once-in-a-century upset in the Eden-Monaro byelection.
item.title: Liberals confident they are in 'striking distance' of Eden-Monaro upset

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: With the Eden-Monaro byelection looming, Anthony Albanese has made his first national spending commitment since becoming leader.
item.title: Labor pledges to reverse ABC funding cuts if elected

item.dc:creator: Olivia Maragna
item.description: The perfect storm of the coronavirus is likely to bring your biggest tax refund yet but pay attention to detail.
item.title: How to avoid costly tax deduction mistakes

item.description: A police officer has been charged with arson, deception and weapons offences over a Melbourne house fire.
item.title: Police officer charged with arson over Melbourne house fire

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia's will buy long-range anti-ship missiles and investigate buying long-range land-based missiles in a Defence shift to focus on the Indo-Pacific.
item.title: Australia to buy ship-killing missiles and shift focus to Indo-Pacific

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Is it better to have a little more in your pocket now or a big pile of cash when you retire? You be the judge.
item.title: Why compulsory super remains a great idea
